text: A horribly deformed figure--hunchback, misshapen head--si on a stool in complete silhouette. This is RICK COOGAN.

Can you imagine it, Regis, Kathie Lee? One day I'm a hot young movie star, and the next day I'm a hideous mutant freak, covered with festering lesions. Oddly, REGIS and KATHIE LEE are also in complete silhouet
Sounds like my wife when she misses a mudpack! The audience CRACKS UP. Kathie Lee pooh-poohs Regis.
Oh Regis! You're incorrigible! Ha- ha! (to Rick, she turns

Ricky, once you were the all- American boy next door, star of the beloved Hey Dude films. Now the very mention of your name makes children scream in terror. We've all read about your disturbing story. But the people want to hear it from you, Ricky Coogan. (SFX: children scream) Won't you tell us your story?
Well, it's kinda long, but okay. It all started when I signed a deal to be spokesman for the E.E.S. conglomerate...

The E.E.S. logo--a large metal shoe with a bar across it, with the words "Everything Except Shoes" beneath. Widen t reveal RICHARD HERTZ, president of E.E.S., smiling rigidl camera. RICK COOGAN is next to him, also holding a stiff movie-star smile. FLASH! They shake hands as the EES photographer takes publicity shots. Off to one side, behi Hertz, are several EES EXECUTIVES. Behind Rick is his entourage: LAWYER, BODYGUARD, TRAINER, STYLIST, and SPIRI GUIDE. 2. Further off, at the boardroom table, four DODDERING OLD CORPORATE FARTS on the brink of death look on with glazed expressions.
(through a clenched smile) So, what kind of crap do you scumbags want me to peddle?
Everything. Everything except shoes, of course. Hah hah... He laughs pathetically. Rick doesn't respond. Hertz nods a nearby EXECUTIVE who hands him some BEEF STICKS.
Meaty Twig Beef Sticks. Rick takes them and holds them up to the camera. Smiles. Flash.

Helmet Head hair spray. He takes the hair spray and holds it up. Smile. Flash. The assistant carefully hands Hertz a pulsating metal container with lots of warnings and danger symbols on it. Hertz gives it to Rick.
Noxon 24 biogenetic neuro- fertilizer. Rick holds it up, then pushes it away in disgust.

Fertilizer? Ricky Coogan does not do ads for hi-tech cow shit. I'm a star, got it, Hertz? (to his aide) Rico, give these misguided clowns Tony Danza's phone number, and let's get the hell out of here. He gives the finger to the EES photographer, who obliging takes a picture. Hertz waves at him to get lost, and call after Rick who's headed to the door with his entourage.
Rick. Wait! Only you can stand up to the radicals trying to keep Noxon from the struggling farmers whose very future depends on it. 3.
Noxon? Wasn't that just banned?
Only in the U.S....and Europe.
But I heard that shit's lethal. Hertz lets out a big laugh. He shakes his head at Rick.

Rick, Rick, Rick... You want proof? Fine. Just take a seat. Please. Rick nods to his entourage. They sit at the boardroom tab across from the EES execs. An easel behind Hertz shows a placard with a bar graph. Hertz whispers something to an aide, who scurries off.
Meet the head of our South American research facility, Juan Valdez. The aide ushers in a handsome LATIN AMERICAN EXECUTIVE in natty three-piece suit and a sombrero.
My name is George Ramirez.
Whatever. He's worked with Noxon 24 every day for five years, and he's in fine shape. Aren't you, Juan? George glares at Hertz bitterly. Hertz stares him down.
Yes. I am fine. Me and my team in Santa Flan have--
Santa "Flan?" What kind of shitty name for a country is that?

It is named for the patron saint of creamy desserts... As I was saying, we've worked very closely with Noxon... 4. Rick nods. We cut back to George, but he isn't George anymore. He has mutated into a similar looking actor, in same suit, the same sombrero, but shorter and swarthier.
I personally supervised its development... Rick furrows his brow. He's a little suspicious of George transformation, but just a little. Now George is even shorter, even swarthier. Yet another actor.

I performed rigorous scientific tests. No potential danger was left uninvestigated... Rick's suspicion is increasing. He looks over to Hertz, w feigns total innocence. George is now even shorter. Still another actor. His clothes are baggy, and the sombrero is starting to slide over his face.

The environmentalists are crackpots, all of them. Rick looks at his entourage. Their mouths hang open in astonishment. George has now shrunk to near-midget proportions. The sombrero completely covers his head. When he takes it off we see he's now played by LINDA HUNT!
It's ridiculous, I tell you. Totally ridiculous! Rick is ready to ask questions, but Hertz cuts him off.
Thank you, Valdez. That will be all. George nods and heads back to his seat. As he passes behi Hertz, he can't resist sticking his thumbs in his ears an making a face.
Wait a second-- 5.
Ricky, this is important. We're talking about a major threat to the EES image. How does 2 million dollars plus expenses sound? The aide reveals a new placard on the easel. It reads "$2
Look, it sounds great, but--

I hear you. Make it five million-- (a new placard: 5 MILLION) that is, if the board agrees ... Hertz reaches beside his chair and pulls a lever. The old geezers beside him raise their arms stiffly, as if they w being pulled by strands of fishing line, which they are.

Good, it's unanimous. Well, what do you say, Ricky? Are you EES's "Man in Santa Flan?" Rick looks at his advisors--they look over at Linda Hunt, then emphatically shake their heads "NO." Rick looks at Hertz, who shows him five big fingers and grins. Rick bre into a big smile and gives Hertz his trademark thumbs up sign.

Rick stands in line at the luggage X-ray machine. He impatiently checks his watch as the X-RAY CHECKER chats h up. A CRAZED ANARCHIST holding a large bomb passes throug the security check unquestioned.
My kids just loved you in "Hey Dude Three: The Final Countdown." We need more wholesome role models like you.
Uh-huh.

Where the fuck is Ernie? 6. We hear WOMEN'S SCREAMS. They turn towards the noise and a bunch of STEWARDESSES scattering from a trendy young ca with a fake hand sticking out of his fly. This is ERNIE, Rick's buddy and resident court jester.
Ladies! All I wanted was a manicure! Yah-ha-ha! (he sees Rick)
Rick pumps Ernie's third "hand." The miffed X-ray checker points to Rick's large carry-on bag as it emerges from th ray machine.
Mister Coogan, is this your bag?
Yeah, why?

Is this your kid? He indicates the X-ray monitor, where we see the skeleton outline of a BUCKTOOTHED, BESPECTACLED 10 YEAR OLD KID cu up in Rick's bag. The kid waves. Rick and Ernie look at each other in horror.
Stuey Gluck! The bag bursts open, and out pops STUEY GLUCK, an obsessi young autograph hound toting a stack of scrapbooks and memorabilia.
Rick! Rick! Look! I got a rare still from your high school production of The Glass Menagerie! Could you sign it for me? Please?!
Let's get the hell out of here! 7. Ernie nods and yanks the bag away from under Stuey. They away down the corridor. Stuey chases them, holding up an by 10 photo.
Rick! Wait up!
Rick and Ernie run around a corner with Stuey in pursuit.
Rick! Remember the speech you gave at the Actors Forum for Social Justice!? He holds up a cassette player and hits play. It's Rick's speech.
If all the world is a stage, then let us shine the spotlight on truth, integrity, and a deep compassion for all life.
Leave me alone, troll!
That was before I got an entertainment lawyer.
Quick, down here. Ernie leads Rick down an adjacent hallway.
It's a dead end. Rick and Ernie are trapped. Ernie gives Rick a sheepish look. Stuey stands at the entrance of the hallway. He holds up a Time magazine.

Rick! Rick! It says here Noxon's dangerous. Why are you lending your name to it? What's happened to you, Rick? You used to be good! And now... I just don't know... Stuey starts to cry. Rick looks guilty.
Don't cry, Stuey, I'm still good. 8. BAM! A passing electric baggage cart nails Stuey at full speed and carries him off down the corridor, screaming bl murder.
Rick and Ernie high five.

A SEXY STEWARDESS pours champagne for Rick and Ernie. The anarchist sits nearby with the bomb on his lap. Rick wink suggestively at the stewardess. She walks off, obviously interested. Rick raises his glass to Ernie, oozing sleazy confidence.

In the bag. The plane hits turbulence, and Rick's drink flies up out his glass--he catches it as it comes down. Another STEWARDESS helps the Anarchist put his bomb in the overhe compartment. Ernie ogles her. She sneers at him. We hear the CAPTAIN'S voice on the loudspeaker.
Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking. To the right of the aircraft, you can see a great view of the Grand Canyon. All the passengers crane their necks to the right.
And to the left you can see a panic- stricken little troll. Rick turns to his window and flings open the shade to reveal...
on the wing, pressing his face up against the glass. He's holding up a publicity shot of Rick and screaming somethi we can't hear.
Stuey loses his grip and is whisked off the wing. Rick watches him fall into oblivion. 9. Relieved, he turns nonchalantly to Ernie, ignoring the ot horrified passengers.
You gonna eat your peanuts, Ernie?
Nah, you can have 'em.
A large haystack sits in the middle of a field. We hear Stuey's approaching scream.
THUD! Stuey misses the haystack by a few feet. He hops to his feet and dusts himself off.
Hey, I'm okay! BONK! His scrapbook falls into frame and beans him.
We see the airliner lowering its landing gear as it makes final approach to the runway.
Here we are Ernie, Santa Spam. World famous for loud music and hot sex!
It is?
Give me a few hours. KA-BLOOEY! The plane explodes in a fireball. Swish-pan to reveal...
Standing just outside the airport. A porter follows with their bags.

Sure glad that wasn't our plane. Ernie nods. They're distracted by the sound of chanting. They squint into the distance, where they see a group of chanting PROTESTERS--young "Save the Earth" types, latter hippies, kids, seniors, etc.

EES mustn't stay! Take your toxic crap away! EES mustn't stay! (etc.) Some of their signs read--"Say No to Noxon!", "Coogan Go Home", "EES is killing our Earth!", "Ricky Coogan Sucks S (this one held by a nice LITTLE GIRL), "I Like Ike" (held a confused OLD MAN, shuffling around aimlessly), "Drink Pepsi" and finally... "Free Nelson Mandela"--we WIDEN to reveal the subheading: "Inside specially marked boxes." We keep WIDENING to reve that this is not on a protest placard, but a box of cerea some GUY is eating as he watches the protest.

Jesus! We better find the limo before these whale kissers chop us up and sell us for parts. (he spots the limo) There it is. Off to the side, away from the protesters, an unmarked li with tinted windows (and plates that say NOT EES) awaits. KEVIN, an EES exec, leans out the window and waves discre at Ricky. The stewardesses, looking tipsy, wave their bra out the back window invitingly. Ernie tries to grab Ricky by the arm, but he resists. He' looking at the protesters.
Wait a second... His POV...

standing in the center of the crowd of protesters, holdin MEGAPHONE to her mouth and chanting. She puts down the megaphone to rest, and we can see that she's powerfully beautiful, in a no-nonsense feminist kind of way. This is JULIE. Rick is smitten. 11.
Let's go, Rick. They're waitin'.
Forget them. I got a better idea. If I can just find the right disguise...
Coog, those hippies'll tear us apart. Rick spots a HEAVILY BANDAGED MAN limping out of the airp on crutches. Rick approaches him, waving a roll of bills.
Hey, how'd you like to make a quick hundred bucks? The man mutters something weakly. Ernie puts his ear up close to hear him better.
He says the pants don't usually come off for less than two-fifty, but since you're so cute, he'll make an exception.
buried beneath rolls and rolls of bandages, making his wa through the protesters on crutches. Ernie helps him along nervously. As Rick spots Julie from behind, he hands the crutches over to Ernie.
Here. Ernie takes the crutches. Rick waves his arms dramaticall clutches his bandaged legs, and winces in pain.
Help! Ow! Give me back my crutches! You monster! Oh, the pain! The agony! He falls theatrically at Julie's feet.
Are you okay? Let me help you! 12.

Thanks. Don't worry about me. What's one man's pain weighed against the global injustice of corporate tyrants like EES? Go. The fight must continue. Julie's buying it big time. She gazes deep into Rick's ey
Wow... My name's Julie.
Josh. Josh Tavner. Ernie sticks a hand out, grinning sarcastically.
Mother Theresa. Glad to meet you. Julie turns on Ernie viciously. She slaps him hard, and grabs the crutches from him.
Ow! Hey!
Give me those, ape. Help him up. Rick rises to his feet "painfully."
Hey Josh, a busload of us are headed over to Maracas to protest Noxon 24 and pelt Ricky Coogan with cow shit.
Same here! You could ride with us.
Us? You're with him? She looks at Ernie, who grins stupidly.
Oh, he's okay. Have you ever heard of an idiot savant?
Sure.
That's Ernie. Except for the savant part. 13. Ernie glares at Rick. Rick smiles at Julie hopefully. Jul looks at them both, and can't help smiling herself.
Ernie drives the battered old convertible which bears the proud logo of Santa Flan Rent-a-Car. There's a Pepsi billboard in the background. Julie massages Rick in the b seat.
(faking terrible pain) Ooooh, my pelvis.
Is this better?
Rick moans and cracks a huge grin through his bandages. Ernie tries to get in on the conversation.

Hey Julie. You know I'm kind of an idea man myself. Like, let's say there's a nuclear war, and the only two people left are you and the Pope... Would you pork him? Disgusted, Julie smacks Ernie sharply and continues massa Rick. Scowling with jealousy, Ernie tries a new approach.
But one thing's for sure. That Coogan guy sure is an asshole, huh?
I'll say! What a total piece of shit. Don't you think so, Josh? Rick grits his teeth.
Well, he's got a few problems.
And what a lousy actor! I mean can you believe that "Hey Dude" crap? 14.
Well, with a script that bad, Coogan deserves an Oscar for coming off as good as he did!
I mean, that's what I read.
Well, he's no Christian Slater.

SLATER!? I could act circles around that one-note hack! He was shittin' his diapers when I was the toast of Broadway! I made grown men cry! I made crippled children laugh! Now all I ever hear is Slater! Slater! Slater! WELL
Enraged, Rick rips the bandages off his face.

You think Slater could improv like this? Make you believe he was an invalid!? Huh!? Julie stares at him in shock. Rick catches his breath, realizes what he's just done, and smiles weakly. Ernie tr to break the awkward silence.
So, do you like Swedish films? Julie gives him a murderous look. FADE TO BLACK.
High wide shot: The car is descending deeper into the wil jungle, towards a huge eerie sunset.
Julie's been lecturing Rick for some time now.
You don't even want to hear the truth about Noxon, do you, Coogan?
I mean, look, I'm not saying this stuff is going to turn anyone into a... a...

on the road behind Julie he sees a crude carnival billboa featuring a painting of a huge worm with a man's head. It reads "See the Incredabel Humin Werm! Only at Elijah C. Skuggs Famus Freek Land." Julie can't see it.
Human worm...
Right. A human worm. I mean, that's just stupid. The point is-- Rick sees another billboard for the freak show. This one features a half-man/half-dog creature and says "See the Aztownding Dawg Boy!"
Dog boy...
Yeah, or a dog boy. That's absurd.
Another billboard. This one features the "Hidyous Frawg Man."
Hideous frog man.

Okay, okay. Now you're just being silly. Human suffering's just a big joke to you, huh? You are sick, Coogan! She turns away from him in a huff and looks out her windo She sees a billboard that reads "See The Hole Amazing Fam of Freekz at Elijah C. Skuggs Famus Freek Land and Mutent Emporeum!"
Cool! A freak show! Let's check it out!
Kind of like a family reunion for you, huh? 16.
Lighten up, Coog, could be a goof.

The car turns into a driveway near a crude, hand painted that says "FreekzTM--Thiss waey" with a messy arrow... We ZOOM IN to the hand painted "small print" on the botto the sign, which reads--"Freekz is a registered trademark Elijah C. Skuggs Enterprises. Any unauthorized reproducti is strictly prohibited without prior written consent."

The car stops at the end of the long, spooky driveway, ju past a sizzling electric fence. Rick, Julie, and Ernie ge out and look around. It's eerily quiet. There is a large dilapidated mining shed complete with ru ducts and a tall smoke stack, a tattered carnival tent wi an ornate stage flat facade, a lopsided outhouse, a creep broken-down farm house, and in the center of it all, a gi molded carnival head with big staring eyes, which slowly rotates on a creaky base. Ernie looks hard at the big eyes. He turns away for a second, then spins around again. The EYES are looking in different direction. Ernie shakes his head and unwraps a chocolate bar.
Isn't it great? It's so "real"...
Real stupid.
Let's go. This place is dead.
Yeah. Where are all the weirdos?

There are no weirdos here. Startled, they turn to see ELIJAH C. SKUGGS, a twisted, haggard old man. He takes a bite out of an ice cream cone which contains the rear half of a chipmunk with a marasch cherry on top. Elijah has bad teeth, a bad shave, and sca eyes. We now realize the giant head is molded in his imag 17.

Mutants, yes. Genetic nightmares, definitely. Children of Hell and twisted masses of living, breathing tormented flesh, certainly. But as for weirdos... not a one. Unless of course you count me! Ha ha ha!
Nah, you seem like a regular dumbshit old redneck to me. Elijah ignores him. Julie shoots him a look and smiles at Elijah.
I'm Julie. And you are...
Elijah C. Skuggs, proud proprietor of Skugg's Fabulous Freak Land and Mutant Emporium. But you knew that. After all, you've ventured miles away from civilization, hospitals, telephones,
police... How may I help-you?
Drop dead. Elijah smiles, unfazed. Julie glares at Rick. She smiles apologetically at Elijah.
We'd like to see your freak show. You see, only by appreciating the variety and innovation of nature can we come to respect the fragile complexity of our global eco- system. Elijah nudges Ernie.
And you come to me looking for weirdos? Ernie shrugs. He goes to take a bite out of his chocolate bar and finds only the empty wrapper left in his hand.
Hey! What the-- He looks behind him, and there--about ten feet away--is.. 18.
warts all over, squatting on the ground and chewing happi This is TOAD. Julie and Rick turn and see him.
Eeuuuwww... (composes herself and
Ahem. Hello. Toad doesn't respond to her waves.

Mr. Toad is my... assistant. As for the show, I'm afraid the next parade of deformity isn't until tomorrow night... Rick and Ernie pretend to be disappointed. They turn to leave. Julie's sincerely upset.
Oh, just our luck... Elijah grabs Rick's shoulder and turns him around.
However! I do have a private exhibit in my shed you might enjoy. I don't usually share it with the general public...
We're deeply honored. But no thanks.
Yeah. We really must be-- He raises his cigarette to his lips, but it's gone! He tu to see Toad, ten feet behind him, puffing away happily. Hmmm. Elijah is already leading Julie towards the shed.
The sideshow tradition has been misrepresented by the media. You don't traffic in human misery. You show society the part of itself it doesn't want to look at. 19.
Yes... Yesm I see... He looks over to Rick and Ernie with a grin that says "Where'd you find this nutty chick?" Rick shrugs and follows, taking Ernie with him.
What the heck. We'll see some pickled dog brains, maybe some pictures of women with, you know, added equipment.
And to think we could be in the limo with those stewardesses. Elijah holds the shed door open for them. It's pitch blac inside. Julie enters. Rick and Ernie follow.
What the hell, Coog, these people are weird, but they seem nice enough.

sits outside the shed. THWAP! Toad lashes out with his te foot tongue, and sucks the bunny into his mouth. He shuff into the shed, crunching contentedly. Elijah closes the shed doors in our face, grinning. we he a lonq peal of EVIL LAUGHTER from inside.
It's dark and spooky. Elijah stands in a pool of light, reading a Family Circus cartoon in the funny pages.
HA-HE-HE-HE! God I love the Family Circus! How do they do it day after day? It's amazing. He turns to...
as Toad finishes strapping them onto massive Frankenstein style operating tables. They struggle desperately against

head_text.subj: ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND

text: Well, I guess they do use the same joke over and over. I'm just a sucker for that little moffet's shenanigans, that's all. (he tosses the funnies

But perhaps I should tell you a little more about what I do. You see, I not only exhibit freaks, I make them. Just like Michelangelo saw the angel in the stone, I look at a guy like Kevin Costner and see a giant peach grub who can fart the Blue Danube! (mops brow, asks
Am I crazy or is it hot in here? Rick, Julie, and Ernie shoot him a look that pretty well answers his question. Elijah shrugs and goes back to his spiel.

Behold! The Tasty Freekz machine! He pulls a tarp off a huge complicated machine. Several drums and vats of various chemicals feed through a crude network of pipes, gadgets and computers into an old Tasty Freeze soft serve ice cream machine (The logo has been changed to "Tasty Freekz"). The biggest vat reads "NOXON
My God! He's using Noxon Twenty- Four!
Hey! You're not supposed to have that stuff!

Oh? Well, I guess I'm not supposed to have these either! 21. He holds up a matching towel and washcloth embroidered wi the "Ramada Inn" logo. Rick, Julie, and Ernie gasp. He tosses the towels. As Elijah gets worked up into a frenzy, the ambience in t room becomes more and more horrific: the sunlight is repl by an eerie green glow, a thunderstorm rumbles to life, a raven perches on the windowsill, a rat scurries across th floor, one of those plastic "Bony Banks" reaches out and grabs a quarter...
I need only punch a few buttons on this magnificent device, and it gives me an easy-to-apply ointment that will mutate a perfect young body, bubble its skin, warp its bones and twist its guts into AN

head_text.subj: TURNING FREAK OF MY OWN DESIGN

text: Elijah's hair is now standing on end. He's foaming at the mouth. A bolt of lightning and THUNDERCLAP cap the monologue.
Wait a minute. Does this mean we're not going to see a show?
Toad, fire up that machine, and let's turn these hapless asswipes into monstrosities!
Now let's see. Who wants to get freaked first?
(points at Julie) Ladies first!
Go screw yourself!
If I were you, I would!
Hmmmm. 22. Toad is adjusting some knobs on the machine. Elijah steps past him to a jerry-rigged computer console. He punches s keys and some rotating DNA models appear on the monitor.
(mumbling to himself) It's like Yin and Yang... AC/DC... two birds with one stone... Yeah, it's pretty darn good, really... He presses "enter" and the computer beeps. He smiles.

Let 'er rip, Toad! Toad yanks a pull-start cord and the machine rumbles to l Elijah pulls the Tasty Freekz lever and fills a small dis with phosphorescent ointment. Toad cuts open their clothe exposing their sides, and pushes them close together.
Wait a second. You're really gonna smear that stuff on us and mutate our body parts!?
Correct.
Well... then could you give me a really big rodney?
I'm a mad scientist pal, not a miracle worker. Elijah smears the ointment on their exposed sides. Their skin begins to bubble and undulate.
Oh God!... No!... Holy shit!

A grapefruit-sized lump pops up on Ernie's side, then ano on Julie's side, and then the lumps do a little synchroni dance together. Suddenly Ernie's flesh balloons out and melds into Julie's side. The mass of connected skin continues to bubble and mutate. Odd shapes press up under

Four humans faces that quickly become Mount Rushmore... The Pepsi logo--"Pepsi: The Choice of a New Generation".. Julie and Ernie merge into one amorphous flesh blob which then takes the form of... 23. Demon versions of GUMBY and his magic horse POKEY. Gumby' got his back to camera. He's grabbing his crotch and flipping everyone off.
Gumby! Put that thing away! Gumby and Pokey mutate back into a blob and then into...
joined side to side, their two heads on a single body whi is split down the middle--half Julie, half Ernie. Elijah wheels a large mirror in front of them.
Feast your eyes!
Well, at least I'll never have to go far for a piece of tail.
Pig! She SMACKS him.
Ouch! I was just trying to keep things light. Oh God! Why me!? He starts blubbering uncontrollably. Toad drags them towa the door.
Mother always said there'd be days like this. And I thought she was nuts! They exit. Elijah turns to Rick.
(gestures to Julie/Ernie) A mere party trick. But you, you're gonna be special. Elijah steps over to the computer console and starts punc keys.
Let me go, Skuggs, or else!
I got some RICK(cont'd) friends that'll come down here and mess you up bad, homey! (Elijah chuckles. Rick tries a different
I got some other friends who can score you box seats at the Superbowl, no problem.

text: (switches gears again) You ever had a hot fudge bath with Morgana? [foreign take: Madonna]
You know her? Rick nods hopefully. Elijah considers it for a moment, th frowns.
Ah, screw it. I'd never get anywhere with her. TOAD! FIRE UP
Toad starts the machine. Elijah pulls the lever and dispenses a bowl full of glowing ointment. He carries it towards Rick, leering maniacally.

For years I've strived to create the ultimate monster. The first of a whole new generation of superfreaks! Now I've finally got you, the perfect subject--a real asshole! HA-HA- (he pauses and looks closer at Rick) Wait a minute. Aren't you the guy from "Hey Dude Three-The Beguiling?"
Yeah, that's me!
You were great in that picture! Oh well, I guess for the next one they'll have to get Christian Slater! HA-HA-HA! 25. Elijah squishes the ointment into Rick's horrified face.
The barn looks especially sinister silhouetted against a green moon. A huge ball of flame belches out of the smoke stack.
It's eerily quiet in the dawn light.

Extreme close-up of Rick's eye as it opens, and searches room frantically. Close-up of Rick's hand--a normal hand- straining at the bonds. RICK's POV groggily searches the lab, and picks up the blurred image of Elijah in the distance. He's on the phon speaking in hushed tones.

This is Red Swan. May I speak to the Laughing Man?... Yes, I'll hold. For a moment, Elijah is entertained by hold music to the of "Freak Out," by Chic. A man's laughing voice comes on other end of the line. It laughs throughout the "conversation".

Laughing Man? Red Swan. I've done it! I found the perfect subject-- huge ego, shallow personality, almost no moral values... A lawyer? No, better. An actor. Yeah, the guy from those hilarious "Hey Dude" movies! Hahahaha-- Laughing man has stopped laughing. Elijah dummies up. 26.
Well, I liked 'em. Laughing man resumes laughing. Elijah listens intently.
Right... Yes... Yes, I see... But that's just it. He's not quite, uh, finished. I need more Noxon so I can-- Laughing Man laughs so loudly Elijah has to hold the phon away.
Geez, what a grouch. Over on the slab, Rick groans. He's waking up. Elijah notices.

(to Laughing man) Laughing Man? I have to go. What about the Noxon? Two days? Great, you can see everything then... Yeah, you take it easy too. Elijah hangs up the phone, and strides over towards Rick.
Wakey, wakey. Time to meet and greet the new you.
Huh? He flips the slab right-side up, and holds up a mirror. Rick's eyes widen in terror as he beholds his hideous new form. Rick's left half has been transformed into a hideou bug-eyed monster!
AAaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!
BANG! The doors fly open. Elijah drags Rick out. Horrified, Rick clutches the monster side of his face. 27.
Oh God! This was my good side!
Still is if you ask me! Hell, even half-done, you'll be the star of the show tonight. Elijah stops in front of the tiny outhouse.
Welcome to your spacious accommodations. He unlocks the door and drags Rick in.
Oddly, the interior is a vast barracks, fifty feet long a thirty feet high. Rick looks around.
Great use of the space.
I learned it all from Bob Vila. BOB VILA walks up next to Elijah.
You know you could expose those rustic beams and put in a skylight over one weekend, Elijah.
Give it a rest, Bob! He pushes Bob away into the freak house, gives Rick a goo wink and walks out the door.
Elijah pauses and looks at the tiny outhouse.
One of these days I gotta put a shitter in there. Bob Vila steps out of nowhere again, holding a Time-Life book. 28.
No problem. It's all here in my Beds and Bathrooms book, Elijah. And you pay nothing for thirt-- BONK! Elijah knocks him out cold with a ball-peen hammer from his tool belt.

It takes a few moments for Rick's eyes to adjust to the d light. There's nobody in sight. The walls are lined with dark cubicles, stacked atop each other with walkways like prison cells. Rick staggers to his feet, and makes his wa forward.
Ernie? Julie?
Over here, Coog.
Are you alright? Rick sees the vague outline of JulieErnie a few yards awa
I know that voice. That's the voice that said,
"Cool, a freak show. Let's check it out!"
What!? Oh sure, blame the woman. Typical.
"It's so real." Is this real enough for you? I'm friggin' Quasimodo!
Chill out, Coog. You're talking to the original tag team of ugly pukes. Step into the light.
Okay, here I come. 29. Rick steps forward into a pool of light. Julie and Ernie caught by surprise. Julie struggles to keep her composure Ernie's repulsed.
Ernie turns away and pukes on the floor. Julie soldiers o
Oh geez... It's not so (GULP) revolting. After all, physical beauty is just a socially-enforced myth that we, uh, oh shit... ULPI Julie turns away and pukes on the floor.
Yeah, well, you're no Mona Lisas yourself. You're lucky I've got a strong stomach!

And you're lucky I don't BITE you! Heh heh heh heh ... Rick wheels around to see JUAN THE DOG BOY, snickering be him. Juan is a hairy young Mexican with a snout, dog ears and canine teeth--Scrappy Doo with an attitude. Rick assumes a threatening pose.
Get away from me you, you...
Freak? Ha ha hahahaha! (he stares hard at Rick) I am Juan the Dog Boy, leader of the freaks.
(walks up to them) Kind of the "top dog." Juan scratches himself behind the ear with his hind leg.

Welcome to Hell, Rick. Shake? He extends a hand to Rick. Rick doesn't take it. He hears slight RUSTLING noise from the direction of the cubicles, turns to look around the apparently empty Freak House. 30.
No thanks. I don't plan on staying long. How many of you are there in here anyway? Juan shrugs mischievously and sticks his snout in Rick's face.
First, I have a question for you, Ricardo. Who starred in the film "International Velvet?"
Huh?

Well, perhaps we should ask the Worm! The top right cubicle lights up, revealing the WORM. He i man with no arms and legs, and the wrinkly, slimy body of worm. His face is learned-looking, with spectacles, a sma goatee, and a pipe which he puffs on pompously.
Tell us, Worm, who starred in "International Velvet?" He puffs pensively on his pipe for a second.
Yes, yes ... very interesting... International Velvet... The perfectly appalling sequel to National Velvet, I believe. No dramatic verisimilitude whatsoever.
Yes, Worm. But who was the star? The worm takes a long, thoughtful drag on his pipe...
Olivia DeHavilland.
Olivia DeHavilland... Rick, do you agree or disagree?
This is nuts. This is crazy... Besides, it was Tatum O'Neill. 31.

Very good. It was Tatum O'Neill, now married to tennis star John McEnroe. Circle gets the square. The lights come on in 9 of the center cubicles, silhouett 9 freaks in a full size HOLLYWOOD SQUARES 3 x 3 layout. T FREAKS applaud Rick's success. He's incredulous.
Yayyy! Worm nudges an "0" into place in his cubicle, with some difficulty. He's not happy about being proved wrong.
Blast. O'Neill ... No talent ragamuffin...
okay, JulieErnie, your turn. Who's it going to be? As Juan names the freaks one by one, their square is highlighted, and they wave at Rick cheerily.
Nosey the Nose Man! NOSEY is a man whose massive nose dominates his head. He blows into a huge hanky, and waves it wearily at Rick.
Cowboy! COWBOY is a young boy with cow-like features, a cowboy ha cowboy clothes, and a full set of udders.
The Bearded Lady! The BEARDED LADY is a big, tough, bearded man--in a blous He has lipstick, earrings, and tattoos on his muscular ar
(gruff and masculine) How ya' doin.
Sockhead! SOCKHEAD is a freak with a large button-eyed sock puppet a head. He's munching cookies which ,spill uselessly out his throatless sock mouth... 32.
The Human Torch! The HUMAN TORCH is a man engulfed in flames. He waves apathetically.
Rosie the Pinhead! ROSIE is a pinhead in dark sunglasses. She has a great bo jammed into a sexy dress. She smokes a cigarette demurely and waves a small, arrogant big-star wave.
The hideous Frog Man! Frogman is just a guy in a scuba outfit. He strikes a threatening "monster" pose, then gives a friendly wave.

And of course, in the center square, Mr. Paul Lynde! Suddenly the lighting changes to flashing red horror ligh with plenty of dark shadows. There's a horrific MUSIC STI and we ZOOM IN to a DECOMPOSING SKELETON in the center cubicle. Its eyeball drips out of the socket.
Well JulieErnie, who will it be?
Call me old-fashioned, but I'll go with Paul Lynde.
Don't be an idiot. They argue back and forth, hitting and poking each other Stooges style. Juan turns to Rick.
You see, Rick? Just because we're freaks doesn't mean we can't have some fun, huh? Rick is overwhelmed by it all. He backs away.
Get away from me. Get away! I'm not like you. You hear me? I'm Ricky Coogan! I AM NOT A FREAK! 33. The Freaks laugh in Rick's face. He storms off.

head_text.subj: ANOTHER AREA OF THE FREAK HOUSE--A LITTLE LATER

text: Rick sits in a corner, pondering his fate. Oddly, there's shiny new Pepsi machine in this dingy corner of the Freak House. JulieErnie approach him.
Okay Coog, so I get twenty four hour access to T `n' A, and you look like a plate of rancid giblets. We're still pals, right? Rick shoots him a look.

All the freaks have gone through this anguish, Rick. At first, I was blinded by my anger. I admit it. I wanted to break your neck for getting me into this. But I got over it. Juan taught me to channel my anger for the common good.
It was your fault, anyway. You wanted to see the freak show.

head_text.subj: I THOUGHT I TOLD YOU TO SHUT UP

text: She tries to wring his neck. Ernie helps. Rick glares at Ernie.
Ernie!
Oh... Sorry, Coog. For a second there, I was a total man-hater. Weird. Julie regains her cool. She takes out a pamphlet, scribbl something on it, and hands it to Rick.
Here. Take it. Rick examines the cover. He reads it aloud. 34.
"So You're a Hideous Mutant Freak-- Now What?" There's an "8" scribbled on the pamphlet.
we're in cubicle eight. Maybe later you'll be ready to talk.

Forget it. Not me. I'm not like those other god-forsaken animals. He throws the-pamphlet to the ground, just as the Worm, Bearded Lady, and Sockhead approach. They sit down in a circle around him. The Worm looks down at the pamphlet an puffs thoughtfully on his pipe.
You're mistaken, Rick. You are exactly like us. We were all normal healthy folk before we made the fateful mistake of visiting this hell hole at an off hour. Why, when I first came here...
The Worm, as an OXFORD PROFESSOR, is wandering around the grounds, taking notes and puffing on his pipe.

I was a professor of lacrophylogy-- er, the study of worms, of course. I came in search of the Epsosophecci dilepsidae--in layman terms, the fat pudgy worm. Mr. Skuggs said he had just such a worm in his shed. How could I have surmised that the specimen and I would ultimately prove to be one and the same? We see professor Worm meet Elijah, and follow him into th lab. The smoke stack belches a plume of flames as we hear his off-camera screams. DISSOLVE back to..
The Worm finishes his tale. 35.

At first, the transformation was fabulous. I truly understood the worm's ethos like never before. But those early days of fascination are over. Now, in retrospect, I think the whole thing is a fucking headache. I'd sell my soul just to be able to wipe my own ass... He sniffles a little, but manages to hold back the tears. pan to Sockhead.
I first came here as a tourist, looking for some fun...
A lanky TOURIST, obviously Sockhead in better days. He approaches Elijah.
Anyway, then Elijah turned me into a sock. That's it.
Sockhead shrugs apologetically.
Sorry. I'm not much for stories. The camera moves in on the BEARDED LADY.
When I arrived here, I was nothing like I am now.
The bearded lady (as a man) steps out of the cab of his eighteen-wheeler. He looks very much like he does now, except he has no lipstick or earrings. 36.
I was confused--a walking contradiction, so full of questions.
He finishes his story.

Now I know who I am. I can say, "Hey world. This is me. I'm a woman. And I like me." The others look at the bearded man uneasily. The camera p past the Bearded Lady, and moves in on an ordinary HAMMER lying on the ground.

Happy music. The hammer is placed on a shelf by a friendl STOCKBOY. The music turns tense as Elijah appears and sca the shelf. He makes eye contact with the hammer, and smil He grabs the hammer roughly and shoves it in a plastic ba Darkness.
The bag opens, Elijah reaches in and takes out the hammer The music turns to Psycho-like string stabs as Elijah use the hammer to smash in a nail.
Everyone looks at the hammer sympathetically. Rick turns away to wipe a tear from his eye.
You are one of us now, Rick. Whether you admit it or not. It's irrefutable.

Yeah. Says you. The worm shakes his head. The freaks turn and head back t their cubicles. Rick exchanges a look with Julie before s and Ernie turn and head off. 37. Rick is left alone, staring pensively at the hammer.
Hours later, Rick is still staring at the hammer. He pick it up and stares at it more closely.
Hours later. Rick is still staring at the damn hammer. He nods with resolve.

You're right. He spots the pamphlet on the ground, picks it up, dusts i off. He opens it and begins to read, under the heading "1 It's Fun Being Ugly!"... Rick closes the pamphlet, looks at the number "8" Julie scribbled, and nods with a sense of purpose. Standing up, throws the hammer carelessly aside into the muck, and wal towards the cubicles.

Rick walks past the cubicles. In one, the Bearded Lady kn a sweater... He reaches cubicle 8, and is about to speak when he hears Julie giggling. There is a man's voice, but not Ernie's. It's Juan. Rick peeks around and sees Julie scratching Juan's belly. licks her face happily, and she giggles with delight. Ern is reading "The Woman's Room," trying not to notice all o this. Rick watches, disgusted. He tears up the pamphlet, throws to the ground, and storms off to find his own cubicle. Ernie peeks at Julie and Juan continuing their foreplay. Juan stops abruptly.
Hey. Mind your business.

Sorry. 38. Ernie returns to his book. The camera PANS up to Rick's cubicle. He's sitting on his cot, distractedly whittling log with his knife-like talon. He talks to himself, makin sure to be loud enough for JulieErnie and Juan to hear.

Well that EES guy should rescue me any minute. Then it's straight to the plastic surgeon and back to sunny old L.A. I wonder how many of my beautiful, anatomically correct girlfriends will be waiting for me.
I'll be waiting for you, Rick!
Thanks, Stuey. Rick looks up and sees a holographic image of Stuey Gluck floating in the air above him.
AHH! A phantom troll! He swings the log wildly at the hologram, but it keeps darting around, dodging the blows. Cowboy leans around th cubicle wall. He talks a lot like Gomer Pyle.
Seeing phantom trolls, Rick?
No. Rick stops swinging, lamely pretends he was stretching, a ignores Stuey, who hovers around him.

Sounds to me like you've developed a telepathic bond. Don't mean yer nuts or nuthin'. Heck, old Nosey, why he can smell the future. Lots of us freaks got E.S.P. And Sockhead, he's got E.S.P.N. He points at Sockhead, who's watching pro wrestling on a portable TV.
Watch out, Hulk! He's gonna try the skull cracker! 39.
Shucks, Rick, you're lucky. Telepathy like yours only occurs between real soulmates. A bond like that should be cherished. Cowboy smiles and ducks back into his own cubicle.
Wow! I'm Ricky Coogan's soulmate!
In your dreams! Now get lost, troll! He swings wildly at the hologram, which starts to break u and fade away.
Wait'll I tell the kids at school! Stuey disappears. Cowboy leans into Rick's cubicle again.
Shucksm Rick, it don't make sense to spurn your soulmate. I reckon that troll could help you if you just let him into your heart. Rick scoffs at him and starts whittling again.
It's a cramped room filled with Ricky Coogan memorabilia. Stuey is drawing a crude sketch of Rick on a pad. This sequence is set to brassy "man on a mission" music.
Once America sees what happened to Ricky, they'll probably send the whole FBI down to save him!
Stuey marches towards a frosted glass door that reads "TH LOS ANGELES TIMES". 40.

I'll probably win a Pulitzer prize for this scoop. And I'll dedicate it to Rick! He walks through the door. Beat. SMASH! He comes flying out through the glass and lands on his butt. THE "TIME MAGAZINE" DOOR--SMASH! Stuey flies out through THE "U.S.A. TODAY" DOOR--SMASH! Stuey flies out through i THE "WEEKLY WORLD NEWS" DOOR--We see Stuey and an EDITOR silhouetted against the glass.
Of course I'll print it! America needs to know! Burt! Give mister Gluck his fee and show him out.
That's okay. I know the way. SMASH! Stuey dives through the glass door.
Stuey proudly reads the weekly world News. The front page features Stuey's story and his sketch of Rick.

"Freaky Deaky! Ricky Coogan's a mutant in South America! By Stuart S. Gluck." (to NEWSSTAND GUY) That's me! Suddenly two GOONS in dark suits snatch the paper away fr Stuey. They grab him and force him into a limousine.
The Goons hold Stuey in between them.'He's terrified. we hear the low, menacing chuckle of the Laughing Man, who's screen. The camera is his POV.
Heh heh heh heh hehh heh. 41.
Sure I wrote the article. But--
Ha-ha-ha!
No. You've got it all wrong. I don't know anything about that. You gotta believe me.
Ho-ho-hahahaha hee hee hoohaaa!
cruises off down the street. We hear a POWER DRILL, Stuey SCREAMS, and Laughing Man's hearty CACKLE from inside.

Rick has whittled his log down to a toothpick. He admires it, then leans over and fits it into an intricate three-f scale model of the Eiffel Tower, made entirely out of toothpicks. The Human Torch walks by.
Wow, what a great model! (he points at a toothpick) But look, this one's crooked. He reaches out to fix it and--WOOF! The whole model burns a cinder. Rick looks at him hatefully.
Sorry. Elijah steps into the freakhouse.
Alright, freaks! Get ready for the glamour! Get ready for the glitz! Get ready to be pelted with rotten vegetables, 'cause it's showtime!
Elijah, looking natty in his Ringmaster suit, stands at t entrance, barking to various people who are drifting in.

It's grisly! It's revolting! It'll make you wish you were dead! And at just twelve bucks a head, you can bring all the kids! We follow a KINDLY FATHER through the curtained entrance. OOF! He collapses, a knife embedded in his chest, reveali the total mayhem...

The motley crowd (LOCALS, sleazy looking MOBSTERS, rogue BIKERS, wayward HIPPIES, and JAPANESE TOURISTS, etc.) is brawling and drinking and having a heck of a time. Some small displays and a few carnival booths are set up around the sides of the tent. There's a "PETTING ZOO" whe a KID is petting a two-tailed-no-headed dog. And there's "HEAVY PETTING ZOO" where a GUY is french kissing a six- legged goat. A CLOWN sits in a dunk tank, heckling the customers. The sign says "DUNK ME IN ACID!"

C'mon, my granny could throw better than you! He's talking to an OLD LADY, who throws a baseball, hits target, and dunks the clown into the foaming bath of carb acid. We hear his gurgling screams, then his bony hand reaches up out of the bath. Elijah walks out on stage and looks at the rowdy audience It's total mayhem.
Quiet, please. Everyone instantly sits down, shuts up, and looks up obediently at Elijah. 43.

Thank you. Ladies and gentlemen, you are about to witness a cavalcade of atrocities so horrific, I advise the more sensitive members of our audience to leave the premises. Two SENSITIVE LOOKING MEN wearing sweaters draped over th shoulders politely get up and leave.

Tonight I'm proud to announce the addition of several new monstrosities to the show, including our star attraction, the Beast Boy--an untamed and highly dangerous ghoul who's liable to go nuts and kill us all at the drop of a hat. (impressed "oohs", "ahhs", and "cools" from the

But first up, prepare to behold an unspeakably repulsive yet heartwarming atrocity, Three Men and a Baby! THREE MEN AND A BABY, all fused into a single multi-limbe freak, walks out onstage. One of its arms holds up a dirt diaper, and all the three men hold their noses and grimac The audience breaks into warm-hearted laughter and applau

The freaks mill around in the caged-in green room, guarde Toad. Frogman, dressed in a magician's outfit over his wetsuit, holds an empty dove cage and searches the room, whistling for his missing dove. Nosey sneezes up a cloud feathers. JulieErnie walk determinedly towards the adjace Men's and Women's restrooms... BONK! They hit the wall between the two doors. Rick is reading his "script", rehearsing his lines. He's wearing a cheesy "jungle" costume.
Arrrggg. I am Beast Boy. I will eat you. Arrrghh. (he throws down the
I can't do this shit! He peers through the bars, scanning the audience for sign a rescue party. 44.
Damn it! What's keeping those guys? The Worm creeps up behind Rick.
Something's troubling you, my boy. what is it?
Well, let's see. I've been kidnapped, hideously disfigured, imprisoned with a bunch of mutant freaks, my rescue party is M.I.A., and this dialogue makes "Hey Dude Three" read like "Dr. Zhivago."

I think I know what you're going through. I too had an eating disorder. You see, I've always had a feverish obsession with pudding. And when I was a young lad... Rick groans and looks out at the audience.
onstage.

And now a perennial favorite here at Freakland, ladies and gentlemen. I know you'll all enjoy the musical stylings of Rosie the Pinhead. Rosie the Pinhead struts out wearing a sexy dress and hol a microphone. After the applause dies down, she whips off her sunglasses with a flourish, revealing her extremely g looking crossed eyes. She wails incomprehensibly and bonk her head with the mic.
A series of WIPES show bits of various acts as the evenin
are doing a Vaudeville style stand-up routine while tap dancing. 45.
Hey Julie, how many feminists does it take to screw in a light bulb?
How many?
Two. One to screw it in and one to ride my Rodney! Ha-ha-ha!
Oaf! She bonks him with their cane. He bonks her back. She knocks him cold. They both fall down.
is doing a make-over demonstration. He's got a local GIRL from the audience sitting at a makeup table onstage.

If your coloring is in the autumn range, like Maria's, try an earth tone eye makeup. Now I've done a lovely French braid on Maria, but I encourage everyone to experiment and use your imagination. The main thing is to just have fun with it. The audience is engrossed. Some take notes.
is ringing those "tuned bells" and singing along.

Edelweiss, Edelweiss. He takes a bow but his sock is snagged on the mic stand. pulls off and reveals a normal-sized hand where the sockh was--he's actually a hand-head! The audience gasps. A MAN gets up and points accusingly.
He's got a hand under there!

It's a hoax! Sockhead realizes he's unveiled and tries to hide his han head with his other hands. The crowd starts jeering and pelting Sockhead with rotten vegetables. He gives them th finger with all three hands. Elijah tries to calm them. 46.
Puppetteering is an admirable skill in its own right! Give him his due!
Where's the beast boy you promised us!? Bring on the beast boy! We want the beast boy! (etc.)
The Worm is still talking to Rick. We can hear the crowd screaming for him in the background.
And when I won first prize, they never called me pudding-head again.
So?

Don't you see? You must turn your hardship into inspiration! You're an actor, Rick! Your body is your instrument, and with it you must play your tragic symphony for all the world! Rick is really moved. Elijah pokes his head backstage.
They're going nuts for you, Beast Boy! You better go out there now! He starts to take off his jungle costume.
(determined, inspired) I'll be right there.
Thank you Worm. I don't really know how I can repay you for this.
You could wipe my ass.
(thinks Worm is joking) Ha-ha! Always the wit, eh Worm? 47. Rick claps him on the back and walks off. Worm is disappointed.
Damn. (he turns to Nosey) Nosey, have I ever told you what a gifted artist you are? Nosey gives him a worried look.

The spotlight reveals Rick, centerstage, poised in Shakespearean garb. The crowd quiets down and focuses on Rick with great respect and awe. A truly dramatic silence Rick pauses for effect and then launches into a soliloquy with bravura.

Now is the winter of our discontent, Made glorious summer by this son of York, But I that am not shaped for sportive tricks, Nor made to court an amorous looking glass, I, that am curtailed of this fair proportion, Cheated of feature by dissembling nature, The audience is riveted. Even Spanish-speaking peasants a mouthing the words. Elijah, however, thumbs through his script, totally confused. The freaks watch through the ba from the wings--completely engrossed, especially Julie. J notices this and pulls her closer to him, but she pushes away. We move in on an erudite British gentlemen in the crowd. God! It's ALISTAIR COOKE! He turns to camera. Subtitle: ALISTAIR COOKE.

If you're having trouble understanding Mr. Coogan's brilliant reading of this soliloquy from Richard the Third, please take advantage of the handy subtitles for the culturally illiterate. 48. A FILTHY PEASANT sitting next to Cooke is trying to liste Rick. He turns angrily to Cooke.
Cooke turns back to the stage. The words in brackets appe as SUBTITLES.
Deformed, unfinished, sent before my time,
Into this breathing world, scarse half made up,
And that so lamely and unfashionable, That dogs bark at me as I halt by them.
Why I, in this weak piping time of peace,
Have no delight to pass away the time,
Unless to see my shadow in the sun, And descant on mine own deformity!

Rick bows. The crowd bursts into applause. They yell "Bravo" and throw bouquets. Rick takes several curtain calls. The freaks cheer for him. Julie is particularly moved--she and Rick exchange a heavy look, laden with romantic potential. NOTE: We will insert an almost subliminal one-frame shot of the Pepsi logo at this triumphant moment. Kevin, the EES executive from the airport scene, walks in the tent. Rick sees him and gasps with joy. He leaps off the stage, runs up to Kevin and hugs him. Kevin is shocke of course. Overcome by the moment, Rick regresses to his self.
I'm saved! Haha! You sorry mutants are gonna rot in this hole while I'm sipping mint juleps by the pool!
The freaks and the audience gasp at Rick's cruelty. Julie shocked--Juan gives her an "I told you so" look. Rick see Julie and catches himself. 49.
I mean, um, I hope you have room for all my friends, heh-heh.
Rick, Rick, listen, I really love this new look you've come up with. But just between you and me, I don't think the guys upstairs would really get it.
What are you saying!?
I'm saying you're ugly enough to burn the nosehairs off a dead nun. The crowd bursts into cruel hysterics, pointing mockingly Rick. Even Alistair Cooke is practically choking with laughter.
Rick looks around, horrified at the sea of evil, jeering faces. He begins to tremble. Then...
springs to life for the first time and glows red with rag His whole monster side awakens and takes charge of his bo with violent intensity. He grabs Kevin's head and screams a new, monstrous voice.
POP! He plucks Kevin's head off his neck and holds it alo The head stares down at Rick in disbelief.
Now you're just being childish. Rick serves the head like a volleyball, smashing it to bi The crowd panics and charges for the exits.
People are trampling over each other in the mayhem. Alist Cooke is crushed under the stampede. 50. The freaks are horrified. Monster Rick growls triumphantl Elijah looks on, intrigued.
Now that's entertainment.

Rick awakens with a start and gets up. He approaches JulieErnie, The Bearded Lady, Nosey and Dog Boy, who are playing a game of "Wheel of Fortune." The cubicles contai large blank blocks, like the "letters" on the game show. far, there's a "D", two "S"s, and a "K" revealed. Rosie t Pinhead plays Vanna White's role.
I'd like to buy a vowel. The Bearded lady yawns. Rick edges towards them.
Hey. The Wheel. Mind if I sit in? Juan advances towards Rick, sneering.
So. Now you don't mind mixing with us--how did you say it--sorry mutants?

Look! I'm sorry for what happened at the show. Can't you just forget it? He shakes his finger at Juan, and notices there's still a human nose stuck on his monster claw. He wipes it off, embarrassed. There's an awkward pause. Ernie breaks the silence.
Hey, shouldn't you tell Rick about your big escape plan? Juan gives Ernie a nasty "shut up" look. He growls at him
Well, excuse me for living.
You have an escape plan?
Listen, Beast Boy, the games are a simple diversion.
Beneath our twisted flesh we freaks cry out for freedom! Aooooooorrraaaagh! Juan howls lustily. He looks to rest of the freaks. They' a pathetic lot, and their half-hearted howl proves it.
Aoo... Beat.
Juan's plan is really ingenious Rick. See, he figured out that--
I figured out that our escape does not include the Beast Boy. No one may discuss the plan with him, understand? Juan gives the others a threatening look. They mumble agreement.
What's the matter with all of you? You trust your lives to a guy just 'cause he can lick his own privates? The freaks ponder this a second, then nod "yes".
You gotta admit, Coog, it's a helluva trick.
Fine! I'll just come up with an escape plan of my own then.
Haha! I have spent a year studying this hellhole, devising the perfect escape. You think you'll just tango right out the door!? Ha! Just try it, amigo.
I will! Rick turns to go. JulieErnie rush over and try to reason with him quietly. 52.
Rick, wait.
Yeah. Don't go off half-cocked. Believe me, it ain't all it's cracked up to be.
This isn't one of your dumb movies, Coogan. Look, Juan's a good dog, a smart dog. I'll talk to him. Don't be stupid, Rick. You can't do it without us.

Forget it! I don't need you, EES, or anybody else! I'll get out of here all by myself, you... you.,. crud sucking pus monkeys! DING DING DING! The letters in the Wheel of Fortune board light up, and ROSIE turns them over to reveal "Crud Sucki Pus Monkeys" as the secret phrase. Everyone claps despite themselves. Juan stares them down. They stop. Rick storms off in a huff. Juan takes Julie's hand and ga deep into her eyes. He kisses her passionately. Julie is watching Rick leave. Juan nibbles her neck, which gets he attention. She scratches Juan behind his ear. His leg instinctively kicks the air. Ernie looks worried.
I'm getting a bad feeling here.
Out of sight from the others, Rick approaches the rear do and tries it. It doesn't open from the inside.
Damn. He peers out through a crack in the door and sees a MILKM getting out of his truck in the driveway.
Psst! Hey, you. Milkman! 53.
The milkman looks over at the outhouse, suspicious.
Yeah... ?
Just the man I'm lookinq for. Be a pal, and give me a hand will ya?
Oooh no! I know you freaks. You'll try anything just to get someone to open that door. Well not me! Ha! He's about to walk away.

Okay. Guess I'll just have to milk the world's biggest breasted woman all by myself. Sorry to bother you. The milkman stops in his tracks. He tiptoes over to the b door of the outhouse, listening intently as Rick goes int his "act."
(in a lusty womanish

Ooohh... Milk me! Milk me now! Milk me hard! (Normal Rick voice) I've only got two hands, all right? Geez. I don't care if Elijah did give you skim milk on the right side, chocolate on the left, and eggnog in the middle. The milkman is salivating at the door.
Gee, I love eggnog! The milkman opens the door eagerly and steps inside. Beat

Hey, what the-- BONK. We hear the sound of bottled buttermilk beaning his soft noggin. Rick walks out wearing the milkman outfit complete with the little six-milk-bottle-carrier thing. 54. He looks around and heads for the milk truck, whistling casually. He notices something. It's ...

Its big eyes are staring at Rick (note: there's a skywrit plane in the distance behind the head, which finishes wri "YOU GOT THE RIGHT ONE BABY: PEPSI") Rick gets to the tru and tries the door. It's locked.

Shit. He looks over at the giant head. The eyes are still stari at him--they seem to have shifted. Rick shrugs it off and looks around. He walks over to Elijah's car. It's locked too. He checks the big eyes. They've moved again. Rick's getting a bit desperate. He sees something else an runs towards it. It's a dry-docked motorboat. It's locked too. The eyes have followed Rick again. He sees something else and runs over to it. It's a bag of golf clubs leanin against Elijah's porch. They're locked too.
Damn! This guy doesn't trust anybody! He looks at the giant head- the eyes are gone, leaving on empty eyesockets! Rick hears A BURST OF MACHINEGUN FIRE behind him, spins around and faces ...
with little arms and legs, wearing Jamaican Rasta hats an aiming smoking Uzi 9mms in the air. They aim their Uzis a Rick. One holds a walkie-talkie, the other holds a big spliff.
A T.V. MONITOR in Elijah's hands, shows Rick staring at u the Eye's POV.
seen in extreme close-up, watches the surveillance monito He speaks into a microphone. We don't see what the room looks like.
Good work, Eye and Eye. 55.
bob in response to Elijah. They have no mouths, but their pupils open and close when they speak.
Rastafari.
(over the walkie-talkie) Now bring the Beast Boy to my, uh, den. Ha-ha-ha-ha! Rick looks worried as they lead him towards the scary loo house.

It's a lovely, suburban den with a coffee table full of magazines like "Better Homes and Gardens," "National Revi and "Freaks Illustrated". Elijah sits in a big Barcaloung smoking a pipe. Rick sits on the sofa. Toad walks up with tray of soft drinks.
Diet soda?
No thanks. Elijah points to a bowl of Fiddle Faddle. Toad sits besid Rick.
Fiddle Faddle? (Rick shakes his head) You sure?
Well, okay. (he scoops some into his
Well, are you gonna torture me or kill me or something?
Torture my greatest creation ever!? Kill the final piece of the puzzle that I've been putting together for years!? Sure, it'd be fun, but I've got a bigger plan, my boy.
And when you ripped off that guy's head, I knew it was working like gangbusters!
But I thought I scared everyone away.

Uh-huh. And then they told two friends, and they told two friends, and so on, and so on. Look at this. Elijah grabs a big mail bag and spills some letters out o the table. Elijah opens one and reads it.

Dear Mister Skuggs, I was shocked and disgusted when my grandson told me about the head-popping beast at your show. Please send me six tickets. (he reads another) Dear Beast Boy, I used to like New Kids on The Block, but you're way cuter. My favorite ice cream is chocolate. Is it fun ripping people's heads off? I love you.
The Beast Boy is on a blood-letting spree, and Oscar is along for the ride! (he looks up at Rick) That one's from Pat Collins!
Yeah, but she loves everything. Rick reaches for the Fiddle Faddle but the bowl is empty. Toad BURPS.

Toad! That Fiddle Faddle is for guests only! You've had enough! Toad is blankfaced. Elijah walks over and refills the bow Rick scoops some into his mouth. Elijah walks to the fireplace and pushes the embers around with a poker.
Look Skuggs--Elijah--I've been in show business all my life. The public does not want to see disgusting, depraved violent filth. 57.
Oh, and I suppose Jake and the Fatman is just a fluke? The phone rings. Elijah looks at it, and back to Rick.
I'll get it. He goes over to the phone and lifts the receiver.

`Yello? On the other end of the line, we hear LAUGHING MAN's insa chuckle. Elijah's smooth smile fades. He turns his back t Rick, who strains to identify the familiar laughing voice Elijah scribbles notes on a pad by the phone.

Yes... Right... Tomorrow... Mmhmm... Mnunhmm... Wow. Okay. You got it... Hasta la vista to you too. Hahaahahaahaha-- Laughing Man hangs up on Elijah. He looks a little pissed off as he turns to face Rick again. Grumbling, he takes t poker in hand, and pokes at the coals angrily.
Okay, Coogan. I'm finished with you for now. Ricky rises and snatches the notepad just before Elijah s to face him.

But listen. I may not be "Mr. Tinseltown", but I damn well know what I like. You're gonna be a hideous killing machine, and that's final! Tomorrow night I'll finish the job onstage! And then, to demonstrate your horrible power, you'll slaughter all the old obsolete freaks in cold bl--HEY! Elijah thrusts the red hot fire poker out and ZAP! He catches Toad's ten foot tongue--curled around the searing poker inches from the Fiddle Faddle.
I told you enough!
Elijah shows Rick out the door. The Eyes scurry out and l back into the sockets in the giant head.

Bye-bye. And remember, try another escape, and I'll feed your balls to Toad. As he walks towards the Freak House, Rick pulls out the n he pocketed. A gust of wind blows it away from him. He chases it behind the carnival tent where... KKCCLIINNK! He runs into ELEVEN PHONY MILKMEN, backing th way around the corner, each carrying their own six-pack o milkbottles. Startled, they turn around. Why, it's the freaks! And they're all dressed as milkmen! Cowboy carrie the hammer, who's dressed in a little milkman suit as wel
Hey Rick, I thought you were gonna come up with your own escape plan?
This is your big plan? A dozen milkmen? Isn't that a little unusual? Juan hadn't thought of this. He pushes himself forward an confronts Rick viciously.
Twelve milkmen is theoretically possible. Thirteen is silly. Looks like one milkman too many, Coogan. He pushes Rick aside. The freaks continue past him.

Fine then. Go ahead. Hope you like reggae, ya flea bitten bastard. Rick watches as the Freaks approach the open courtyard, w he knows the Eyeballs will spot them. 59. Julie glances at him a second, then looks away. His mind made up, Rick takes a deep breath.
Ah, shit. He runs over to the Freaks. He stands in Juan's way.
Look, you'll all be killed. You don't know about Elijah's giant Rasta eyeballs with machine guns... (they think he's nuts) It's suicide! I can't let you do it.
And I can't let you stop us. This is it. Rick and Juan square off. Juan growls and bar his teeth. Rick's MONSTER EYE starts to glow and pulse dimly. They circle each other. The others are transfixed.
He peers through a side window, and sees the pack of milk cheering two of their coworkers, locked in mortal combat.
That's a lot of milkmen on the same route. No wonder they fight. Juan rears back, about to lunge, when suddenly he freezes looks off into the distance.
is sitting innocently a few yards off.

Squirrel! He zooms off after the squirrel. The Eyes pop out of the giant head and follow after him, Uzis FIRING. Juan dodges their bullets and disappears after his prey. The freaks watch their best chance of freedom run off aft pesky rodent. They turn to Rick.
Wow, giant Rasta eyeballs, just like Rick said.
Gosh, if it wasn't for Rick, we'd all be dead! 60.
Yeah! Way to go Rick! Alright!
God, I can't believe he left you for a squirrel. What a dick. Julie's hurt. She doesn't even smack Ernie.
You know how men are. Besides, it was a pretty good looking squirrel. Julie looks at Rick. She sees he's trying to be helpful, sarcastic.

(to the others) Come on. You heard the Beast Boy. Back to the Freak House, now. Her eyes meet Rick's. She manages a smile, and Rick smile back. Ernie sizes up the situation and groans as they all head back to the Freak House.
Not again.
Oh well, at least we'll get to try a new position.
We're moving in towards a door in this desolate, vaguely corporate looking hallway.

We're looking at the back of Laughing Man's leather chair We hear his CACKLE, as well as STUEY GLUCK'S TORTURED SCR and a horrible POWER TOOL NOISE. We can see the usual bri interrogation spotlight, and a couple of extra GOONS watc the goings on, but Stuey and his actual torturer are hidd by Laughing Man's chair.
We move past Mr. Big's chair to reveal Stuey lying face d on a table, while Bob Vila is using a power sander on his butt. Bob is happily giving pointers to the two goons. 61.
Notice the way I use an elliptical motion to chafe Stuey's buttocks. (the Goons nod
It's all here in my new book: Pipes, Fixtures, and Torturing
(Loud, sharp laugh)
Bob obediently shuts up. Laughing Man directs a sinister chuckle to Stuey.
No way. I'll never talk! I'm made of stone! Bob considers this a second, then starts up a jackhammer.

We hear LONESOME HARMONICA MUSIC as we pan past the cubic Cowboy is playing the harmonica... The Bearded Lady untie the pretty pink ribbon in his hair and sets it aside... Suddenly, we switch to HORRIFIC PSYCHO STINGS as the came picks up PAUL LYNDE'S CORPSE with flashing red lights. Hi eyeball drips out of the socket again... Then it's back to the SAD HARMONICA MUSIC. In the next cubicle, Ernie is sleeping, Julie is awake, dreamily fond a large eclair. She looks longingly up towards Rick's cubicle as we...
Rick (his face is normal) and Julie kiss passionately in billowy white bed amidst puffy clouds. 62.
Julie, compared to this, sex with Julia Roberts was a thankless chore.
We follow her gaze, panning up to Rick. He's lying on his bed, dreamily fondling a donut. He looks down towards Julie's cabin...
Rick and Julie kiss passionately. We're tight on them.
Oh Rick, you've touched a place in me no one has ever touched before.
I'll say! Almost punctured a kidney! WIDEN to show Ernie, still attached to Julie, leering at Rick. Rick is mortified.
Rick sits in his cubicle, visibly sickened by his daydrea Stuey's echoey voice drifts in.
Rick! Riiiicccck! A holographic image of Stuey lying on the torture table appears over Rick. We can see the jackhammer looming over Stuey's face. Rick looks alarmed.
Rick! Do something! It's up to you, Rick! Pleeeeeeease!
Aha-hee-hee-ho-ho-har-har-har! 63.
The Laughing Man! Rick watches the hologram break up and disappear. Wheels spinning in his head, he takes the crumpled piece of pape out of his pocket and reads it.
(under his breath) Holy shit!
Julie and Ernie are struggling over a bottle of deodorant
It says it's strong enough for a man!
But it's made for a woman! She grabs it away and shoves it in Ernie's mouth. Rick wa in.
Hey Rick. What's up?
Read this. I grabbed it from Skuggs' office. He hands her the notepaper. She reads it, with some difficulty. Ernie is still gagging on deodorant.
"Tape Donahue... Renew Subscription to Beaver World..." Eeuw! She gives Rick a disgusted look. Ernie mumbles with the deodorant in his mouth.
(interested, muffled) Beaver World!? Julie smacks him--he swallows the deodorant.
After that. 64.
"Prepare demonstration for Laughing Man, receive five thousand barrels of Noxon." Five thousand barrels!?
Elijah's up to something big, and we have to stop him. Ernie BELCHES. Rick sniffs the air.
Mmmm. Jasmine.
Rick takes a deep breath, and begins his presentation to freaks assembled before him.
Alright guys, listen up-- Sockhead suddenly freaks out.
We're done for! We're done for! I don't want to die! It's the end of the world! The apocalypse! Aahh! He stops. Everyone is staring at him.
I haven't said anything yet.
Sorry. I'm not much for timing. He takes his seat again.

Tomorrow night, at the show, I'll be turned into a homicidal monster and forced to kill you all. But we might have a chance if we act fast. And I'm prepared to be your new leader. A THRILLING CHORD. 65.
I say we kill him. Sockhead nods.
And I've got a plan. ANOTHER THRILLING CHORD.
I still say we kill him. Sockhead nods again.
If we can get into Elijah's lab, maybe we can--
Of course! Design a super freak of our own and manipulate the genetic code to make him destroy Elijah instead of us! Brilliant!
Oh. Well--
But how do we get to the lab?
Um, maybe--
Right! The worm could dig a tunnel!
By God, it's so crazy it might just work!
But you need Noxon 24 to make the freaking sludge, and Elijah told us himself he's run out of it.
Oh. Oh yeah. Well, see, what I was going to say was-- 66.
Yes! Exactly! If they've been using Noxon 24 as a fertilizer here, the entire ecosystem must be soaked with it! All we need is a way to extract it from the vegetation, ideally into a liquid form.
Right. Well, what about--
Golly! So that's why my milk comes out that funny green color! I thought the grass tasted funny! Wow, Rick, you're a genius!
Good thinking, Rick. The freaks all nod in agreement.
Way to go, Rick! How did you ever think of such a plan? Rick pulls out an old comic book and points to an ad for Monkeys.

Well, actually, I was going to suggest we send away for sea monkeys, train them to fire guns, and make a break for it. But if you want to go with this other thing, I guess that's okay. The freaks stare at him, not sure if he's kidding or not.

-Nosey milks Cowboy, squirting the glowing milk into a fu which feeds into a crude still. The Torch heats the boile -The Worm digs the tunnel. JulieErnie hand Rick pieces of wood which he puts into place as tunnel supports. They ha him Paul Lynde's corpse and he wedges it in as well. 67. -Everyone's getting into it and working up a sweat. Nosey wipes his brow, opens a bottle of Pepsi and chugs it down a beautifully lit slo-mo product shot... The other freaks follow suit, including the Worm, down in the tunnel, who struggles to hold the bottle in his tiny feeler. Everything's going great and the song is really pumping when...
runs out on his front porch in his nightclothes and screa down at the outhouse.

head_text.subj: WOULD YOU TURN DOWN THAT GODDAMN

text: Nosey turns off a boom box and the music cuts short. The freaks exchange tense looks. Nosey calls out apologetical to Elijah.
(to the freaks) What a jerk!
The Worm burrows along, leaving a tunnel wide enough for and JulieErnie to crawl after him. Rick notices a ray of light coming through a rock formation.
Hey, look at this! They all stop and look. Rick fingers the hole, and the ro cave in, revealing
It's obviously a matte painting.
Good Lord! It's the Lost City of Nodd!

Wow! 68. KER-CHUNK! We hear the sound of a slide projector switchi slides and the underground city is replaced by a still im of some tourists standing around a geyser. [foriegn versi the Blarney Stone].
It's Old Faithful! (foriegn take: "It's the Blarney Stone!"] They "Ooh" and "Ahh". The image switches to a snapshot of FAT MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN.
It's my Aunt Gladys! The other freaks nod politely. The image switches to a BA MITZVAH PHOTO.
And that's me at my bar mitzvah!
C'mon Ernie, let's go.
Wait, you gotta see the ones from sleep-away camp! They're hilarious! Julie smacks him.
Stooge!

It's an "Antfarm View" of the yard, where the freaks are visible tunneling underground, and Toad is visible on the yard above them. We see a bat fly overhead... ZAP! Toad shoots out his tongue, snags it out of mid air, and chews happily, oblivious to the freaks burrowing right undernea him.
Nosey looks at the nearly full container of distilled Nox
Almost there. (he sniffs the air) But wait, I'm getting a whiff of things to come! 69.
What do you smell?
Blood. Bearded Lady looks grave..Nosey sniffs again.
And hot buttered popcorn!
Awwright!
They're burrowing along. Ernie loudly clears his throat. Julie spits out a loogie. She grimaces.
I hate when you do that. We hear muffled BARKING.
Hey! Do you hear that?
It's a dog!
Hurry! The Worm breaks through into a small cavern with several exposed sewer pipes. A lovable mutt leaps out of a pipe a drops an old tennis ball in front of Rick. He starts lick Rick's face.
Scrappy! SAPPY MUSIC wells up.
It's been ten years since you chased this ball into the sewer! I thought you were gone for good!
Yap! 70.
Listen Scrap. Go home. Get help. Understand?
Yap!
Good boy! Now go! Scrappy runs away into the sewer pipe. Rick shrugs.
You never know. Julie taps on some exposed wood on the cavern ceiling.
Look, a wood floor.
It must be the lab! we've done it! They all look at each other excitedly. Suddenly Elijah's voice rings out behind them.
Not so fast, you scabrous freaks! They spin around and see Nosey holding the bottle of Noxo 24. He grins.
Didn't know I did impressions, did ya?
The freaks are waiting around the hole. Nosey pops out.
Mission accomplished. They've got the Noxon, and they'll be in the lab within minutes.
Boy, this is going like clockwork! Everyone smiles, pats each other on the back, etc. Except Sockhead, who finally snaps.
No! Can't you see we're digging our own graves!?
It's nuts, SOCKHEAD(cont'd) that's what it is! Nuts! Well, maybe you've all got a deathwish, but you can count me out! I'M GETTING THE HELL OUT OF

He runs amok, pushes various freaks to the ground, and ru around screaming. The freak house door opens--Eye and Eye step in to check out the noise. One of them has a spliff sticking out of its pupil. Sockhead charges at them like mad dog. They aim their Uzis.
(at the Eyes)

RATTA-RATTA-RATTA! They spray an ungodly amount of bullet into Sockhead. He falls to the ground. The Eyes leave. The freaks gather around Sockhead. Nosey pulls the sock o his hand head, which is making a little "Senor Pepe" face with its fist. It spits up a trickle of blood and tries t speak.
I... I... just... wanna...say...
What is it, kid?
Ah, forget it. I'm not much for dying. He goes limp.
JulieErnie, the Worm, and Rick are just emerging from the hole. It's really dark in the lab.
Shit. I can't see a damn thing.
Keep your voice down, Ernie.
Don't push me, Coog. I got a real short fuse today. I'm cranky, bloated, got a wicked case of cramps. Don't ask why. 72.
(whispers to Rick) PMS...
(has to think about this) Oh.... Right. Rick pats Ernie on the shoulder reassuringly. He moves ov to Elijah's computer terminal.
Well, here it is--the control panel for Elijah's Freaking process.

Good work, my boy. Now step aside. This is scientist's work. Worm muscles Rick out of the way and sits at the console. Using a pen held in his mouth, he flicks a series of swit and punches a fast series of computer keys. The light on top of the Tasty Freekz machine starts to revolve, and after a couple of seconds, a stream of GOOEY LIGHT BROWN GLOP oozes out of the spigot.
Hey! It's working!
You did it, Worm! Way to go!

But how? You didn't even use the Noxon. The Worm rushes over to the container of glop below the spigot, and without hesitation, plunges his face into it! Rick, Julie, and Ernie gasp in horror! The WORM lifts his glop-smeared face out of the bowl, and smacks his lips in delight.

Ah! You don't need Noxon to make Butterscotch pudding. I just wanted to test the machine's capabilities. Mmmm! Glorious! So creamy! Yum! The Worm is lost in his pudding-induced reverie. They ign him. Julie turns to Rick. 73.
Hang on, Rick. Do you really think we should put this toxic glop on you? What if it doesn't work? What if something goes wrong? What
If it does work, do you think there'll be enough left over to give me a monster size rodney? Julie goes to doink Ernie in the eyes, but he uses the classic "Three Stooges" handblock.
Here, hold this. Rick hands the container of Noxon to Ernie. Julie gives h the eyepoke. Rick shakes hands with Julie, and takes back the Noxon.
Thanks. (to Julie, heroically) Look, I've been a freak all my life.' I realize that now. Up there on that screen, humiliating myself for every fool with six bucks in his pocket--
Seven bucks.
Sometimes seven fifty.
Alright. It doesn't matter.
Sure it does. They don't let you into the theater if you don't pay the price of the ticket.
Look, I'm talking about the ultimate human sacrifice.
No kidding. When you consider money for parking, popcorn, drinks... 74. The worm chimes in, still gorging himself on pudding...
Don't forget a sitter for the children! Rick's had enough.
Hey! In case you haven't noticed, I'm about to commit a noble and selfless act here. Rick pounds the table, sending a glass beaker flying. It smashes through the window, setting off a loud SIREN.
Elijah's in his robe, watching the opening of "Crooked Co on TV. On screen is a revolving police beacon on a beat-u car, with a loud SIREN. Elijah munches his popcorn happil
Julie manages to silence the alarm by yanking the cord ou its socket. She shoots Rick a hard look, he shrugs innocently.
Oops.
Okay. Let's do what we came to do, and this time, no more screw ups. Rick slams his hand down for emphasis and impales it on o of those desktop paper pins. He SCREAMS in agony.
Elijah's watching an old war movie--a soldier is running across a battlefield with a bayonet, SCREAMING. He doesn' hear Rick.

Julie has her hand over Rick's mouth, silencing his screa He calms down. He gingerly slides the pin out of his hand grimacing but not making a sound. He sighs with relief. T coast seems clear. Then, in SLOW MOTION, his hand knocks styrofoam cup off the desk and onto the ground. 75.
The war movie has erupted into a massive battle--machine blaring, grenade launchers and bazookas booming, the work Suddenly, his ears perk up, and his head swivels around towards the window.
Styrofoam cup? He puts on his "smiley face" robe and bunny slippers and heads out the door.
Julie is pouring the distilled Noxon into the top of the Tasty Freekz machine.
Don't you think we should make some more pudding first, as a test?
No. Here goes. He presses some buttons on the computer, and the Tasty Fr machine starts humming. Ernie is looking out the window.
Somebody's comin'! Hurry.
We have to wait. There's no way to speed up the machine.
Elijah comes out of the house and walks towards the lab.
Rick's starting to sweat. He looks over at Julie, who hol an empty Pepsi cup under the Tasty Freekz spigot. A drop ointment drips out and into the container.
Here it comes.
begins to turn slowly. 76. Everybody freezes. The flow of ooze slows to a stop.
It's plugged up! They look over at the doorknob--it's still turning.
If it's your damn pudding, I'll ring your wormy neck.
(under his breath) Preposterous... I have no neck. I'm a worm, imbecile.
is still turning, agonizingly slowly...
Elijah is trying to turn the knob,, His grip keeps slippi because of the butter on his fingers.
Aaargh! Damn buttered popcorn!
The spigot has started to discharge more,reliably. The Pe cup is filling up now.
Elijah is wiping his hands off on his shirt tails. He tri the door knob again.
We hear a low rumbling and the floor starts to shake.
The tunnel walls are about to collapse!
You go ahead. I'll catch up.
